requirement.topic: XmlBlaster allows store messages in a persistent store
requirement.description: Using the QOS flag <IsDurable/> allows to mark a published message as durable. It will be stored into the persistence store as specified in xmlBlaster.properties file. Default is a primitive file-system based driver org.xmlBlaster.engine.persistence.FileDriver. You may plug in other drivers to store the message into your own database.
requirement.example: <qos> <IsDurable /> <!-- Message is saved to disk --> <!-- Default is transient (messages are lost after xmlBlaster restart) --> </qos>
requirement.author: ruff@swand.lake.de
